page.title: Community Resource Hub
page.body:
We all need support from time to time. This guide is designed to help you quickly find available services and resources in the Austin area. If you’re having trouble navigating this guide or can’t find what you’re looking for, please ask a librarian for assistance.

Do you need...

Health Resources?

Visit these websites to see what is available for you…

  • Austin Public Health (This organization is a department with the City of Austin and offers various services, resources, and education on all things health for Austinites)
  • Information on immunizations and where you can get them at
  • Information and education on preventing diabetes
  • American Heart Association (This organization focuses on providing information and services to help prevent heart disease)
  • Check out their informational videos on YouTube
  • Communities for Recovery (This organization offers long-term services and support for people wanting to enter recovery from substance abuse, or people in need of long-term support while in recovery)
  • Mama Sana Vibrant Woman (An organization that provides free pregnancy, birth and postpartum support to pregnant people of color in Travis County)
  • NAMI of Central Texas (An organization that provides education, support and advocacy for all indivudals affected by mental illness)
  • Texas Harm Reduction Alliance (A mobile and street-based outreach team that serves people at risk of opioid overdose in Austin)
  • WIC Clinics (Women, Infant, and Children clinics are available all around the city and help families with access to vital healthcare resources)

Education and Training Resources?

Visit these websites to see what is available for you…

  • AISD Adult Education and Literacy Program (Austin Independent School District and Austin Community College host classes in collaboration that teach English Second Language (ESL) classes for free, for adults 19 years of age and up)
  • Austin Public Library – Virtual Education and Training Opportunities (The “virtual library” at Austin Public Library provides many platforms and programs that can help you with education and training, in many different fields and interest areas)
  • Foundation Communities – Education Programs (This organization offers onsite educational programs for children, teens, and adults)
  • Free Minds (A partnership program of FC, UT, and ACC that offers a free year-long college course in humanities to adults who have faced barriers in education)
  • Literacy Coalition of Central Texas – (This organization focuses on adult education, literacy, job preparedness, help getting a GED, and more. This link will take you to their Career Development Education offerings.)
  • Northstar Digital Literacy (This organization helps you improve your computer skills through free classes)

Digital and Technology Resources?

Visit these websites to see what is available for you…

  • Austin Free Net (This organization has a mission to “build a world without digital barriers” that offers programs such as “Learn and Earn” to help provide free technology devices to qualified community members)
  • Latinitas (An organization focused on empowering girls to innovate through technology and media)

Job Application and Career Resources?

Visit these websites to see what is available for you…

  • Austin Public Library – Job Portal (The “Job Portal” at Austin Public Library helps you with the basics of preparing to get a job, such as: Getting an email address, creating a resume, searching for jobs, etc.)
  • Austin Urban Technology Movement (AUTM) (This organization helps Black and Hispanic communities with job placement in the tech industry, career development, and networking opportunities)
  • Goodwill Central Texas (This organization offers career advancement training, educational opportunities, and helps you find a job)
  • Indeed Jobs (This organization shares available jobs on their platform, and also employs people in Austin, TX)
  • Indeed and Goodwill Partnership (These two organizations have partnered together to make finding jobs, submitting applications, and preparing for interviews easy with hands-on support)
  • Justice Planning Workforce Development Team (A group that provides reentry and employment services to individuals with previous justice system involvement)
  • Literacy Coalition of Central Texas (This organization focuses on adult education, literacy, job preparedness, and more)
  • Workforce Solutions Capital Area (This organization connects local job seekers with local employers, trainers, and career development opportunities)

Housing Resources?

Visit these websites to see what is available for you…

  • Austin Public Health “Neighborhood Resource Centers” (This program that helps provide emergency rent, utility, and food assistance to low-and-moderate income families in need)
  • Austin Tenants Council (This organization rectifies Fair Housing Act violations and empowers tenants to exercise their rights through mediation, advocacy, and education)
  • City of Austin Housing and Displacement Prevention (Resources from the City of Austin)
  • ECHO (This organization helps people in Travis County who are experiencing homelessness or are fleeing domestic violence situation and need housing)
  • Check out their emergency housing voucher program
  • Check out BASTA, a program that helps renters improve conditions in their homes and communities
  • Foundation Communities (This organization connects citizens to affordable housing units that they own)
  • See what resources they offer and if you qualify

Money and Financial Resources?

Visit these websites to see what is available for you…

  • Austin Public Health “Neighborhood Resource Centers” (This program helps provide emergency rent, utility, and food assistance to low-and-moderate income families in need)
  • Foundation Communities – Prosper Centers (“Prosper Centers” are a part of the work Foundation Communities does around the City of Austin and can help individuals and families with programs that help build pathways to financial wellness, higher education, health coverage, and more)
  • Social Security Administration Retirement Benefits (Federal benefits for those who qualify)

Social Services Resources?

Visit these websites to see what is available for you…

  • Austin Public Health “Neighborhood Resource Centers” (This program helps provide emergency rent, utility, and food assistance to low-and-moderate income families in need)
  • Austin Public Library Community Resource List (This is a list compiled by librarians at Austin Public Library based on resources they are asked about most often)

Couldn’t find what you’re were looking for? Visit ConnectATX! ConnectATX provides up-to-date information on local resources such as food, housing, transportation, childcare, and more!

Search For Other Local Resources at
